alert.note: Alert for Emmet (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 12 at 8:29PM CDT until April 12 at 9:15PM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: The National Weather Service in Des Moines has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Emmet County in northwestern Iowa... * Until 915 PM CDT. * At 829 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Swan Lake, or 7 miles east of Estherville, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Okamanpedan Lake around 840 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Iowa Lake. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for north central and northwestern Iowa.
